name: Albergue & Hostal del Glaciar

reviews.title: Hostel - more like hotel
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Libertador hostel for 2 nights in El Calafate. We had our own private room with a bathoom (great shower!). The hostel was near the main avenue (with restaurants and shopping) just over a small bridge. We had earlier stayed at hotels during our 2 week trip through Argentina, and had to remind ourselves not to compare the hostel to a hotel. The cons included a window that looked out onto a concrete wall; the bed was just okay, the room was a bit small; the room door and window were rather flimsy - bit worried that the room was not secure; and we could hear everything from outside the room. If the hall was carpeted that may have help reduce noise.

reviews.title: Fabulous Hostel
reviews.text: However, for a hostel - the pros are that the bed was okay ;-)

reviews.title: LOVED the Albergue del Glaciar!
reviews.text: Also, centrally located; our own bathroom; great breakfast; friendly and helpful staff; we arranged a tour of the infamous glacier through the hostel; and other visitors were just as friendly. The tour of the glacier was perfect. Fantastic tour gude - she was the best. Not sure we would have scored such a great tour or tour guide without the hostel.

reviews.title: Excellent hostel
reviews.text: Another bonus is the cost. We saved $$$$ - which meant more $$$ for other things (shopping, eating, etc). We stopped by the new trendy hip hotel that recently opened in El Calafate - and it just seemed out of place. The costs were triple (if not more) than the hostel - and we were glad to be at the hostel as it fit the town and our experience there better than the trendy, hip place.

aka: Albergue & Hostal Del Glaciar El Calafate, Argentina - Patagonia
